title: Sweet Chili Shrimp
summary: The recipe Sweet Chili Shrimp is ready in about 15 minutes and is definitely a spectacular gluten free, dairy free, whole 30, and pescatarian option for lovers of American food. This recipe makes 4 servings with 321 calories, 24g of protein, and 9g of fat each. For $2.98 per serving, this recipe covers 14% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It works well as an affordable main course for The Super Bowl. 14 people have made this recipe and would make it again. Head to the store and pick up olive oil, pineapple chunks, shrimp, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the olive oil you could follow this main course with the Sauteed Banana, Granolan and Yogurt Parfait as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 58%. This score is solid. Similar recipes include Sweet Chili Shrimp, General Tsoâ€™s Sweet Chili Shrimp, and Thai Ginger & Sweet Red Chili Shrimp.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Ziobaffan Organic Pinot Grigio. It has 4.6 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ziobaffa Organic Pinot Grigio has fresh rich aromas of apples and pears with hints of citrus that fade into a floral bouquet and on the palate it is bright and fresh with wonderful fruit flavors.ZIOBAFFA Pinot Grigio pairs well with a wide array of lighter cuisine, especially fish/shellfish, poultry, pastas in cream sauce and softer cheeses. It's also an ideal aperitif. Blend: 100% Pinot Grigio
